p: Lee et al. (South Korea) isolated flavonoids (jaceosidine, eupafolin, luteolin, quercetin, apigenine) and coumarins (esculetin, esculetin-6-methylether, scopoletin) from 80% aqueous ethanol extracts of whole A. vulgaris plants, and indicated that these compounds are good inhibitors of mouse brain monoamine oxidase (MAO) enzyme. The compounds showed MAO inhibitory effects at the IC 50 values of 19.0, 25.0, 18.5, 12.5, 1.0, 31.1, 32.2, and 45.0 Âµmol, respectively [ 107].
